intro: Populus bachofenii, commonly known as Bachofen's poplar, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive bark that is smooth and grayish in color. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in catkins, which are typical of the Salicaceae family. It thrives in cold, high-altitude environments and is adapted to harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Populus bachofenii is considered a vulnerable species.
